text: today I'm gonna make something a little
bit unusual it's a red tomato chutney
you may have had green tomato chutneys
in the past but today I'm using the red
tomatoes because its peak tomato season
you can also use canned tomatoes but why
bother when it's such a great time of
year for tomatoes what I'm starting off
doing is blanching and peeling two
pounds of tomatoes I've removed core and
I've cut an X in the bottom of all my
tomatoes and I have a pot of boiling
water here so as an alternative to the
fresh tomatoes you can use can to use
two cans of diced peeled tomatoes I'm
using two pounds of fresh plum tomatoes
let them cook for about 30 seconds to a
minute the skin is already starting to
split as you can see and that's how I
know it's time to take them out to stop
the cooking process I'm going to put
them into a bowl of ice water let them
sit in there until they cool off a
little bit and then you can slip the
skins right off most of my tomatoes have
already been peeled but I'll show you
how to peel this just use a paring knife
to grab the skin between your thumb and
the knife and the skin should peel right
off the riper the tomatoes the easier
the skins will slip off but in this case
it doesn't matter if the tomatoes are
slightly under ripe because you're
making a chutney which is often made
with green tomatoes so those sort of end
of season tomatoes work good here
combination of super ripe and slightly
under ripe would be okay
now you want to get the seeds out you
can just scoop the seeds out with your
fingers you don't need to be SuperDuper
particular here a few seeds here there
won't hurt anyone then you can dice up
your tomatoes you'll have about four
cups of tomatoes total which is pretty
close to the equivalent of what you get
with two 14 ounce cans of diced tomatoes
that has a little bit more juice and
this has a little bit more pulp I guess
is what it's called but that's good
tomatoes are prepped now you want to get
your aromatics ready
I need a tablespoon of minced ginger I
like to just cut these tiny little
pieces off they are kind of hard to peel
around then use the edge of your spoon
make sure you use a thin spoon if you're
gonna use this method you can use a
peeler as well I like this method
because it removes very little of the
flesh and just gets the skin however if
you try to use a thick edge spoon it
really doesn't work very well at all I
like to cut in two rounds first to start
off before I mince what you're doing
when you do that is you're cutting those
long fibers across into smaller very
very short fibers so they're not so
stringy and then cut the little six
crosswise in two minutes
there you go you need a tablespoon of
ginger one onion diced chutneys are
really great because they're a
combination of sweet and savory and go
with lots of different kinds of cooked
meats and stuff like that grilled foods
fantastic
braised foods fantastic roasted kind of
anything most of them start with a base
of ginger onion and garlic I have one
clove of garlic that I'm gonna mince and
then everything's gonna get sauteed
together all right now it's time to
saute you need two tablespoons of
vegetable oil in a medium-sized saucepan
and you'll saute your onions garlic and
ginger all at the same time you want
them to get translucent shouldn't take
too long
I finally minced my onion and so it
should only take about three minutes I'm
gonna add a little bit of salt I'll
start with a half a teaspoon and then
I'll taste it once it's cooked and add
more if necessary but it cooks down a
lot you don't wanna over season in the
beginning because the flavor can
intensify
once the onions are translucent you can
add your tomatoes and any juices that
have accumulated a little spare aroma
then add a half a cup of light brown
sugar tightly-packed
half a cup of golden raisins you don't
have golden raisins or you have regular
raisins you want to use those go right
ahead and a half a cup of red wine
vinegar now what you want to do is cook
all of this down until it reaches a like
dense Jam like consistency cooks for
about 35 to 40 minutes it reduces to
slightly less than 3 cups if you can
believe it
after 35 to 40 minutes look at the
change that has occurred in this chutney
it's quite incredible spoon it into your
jars it's very thick I'm gonna keep mine
in the refrigerator and serve it with
all of my grilled meats it's red tomato
and ginger chutney a little twist on the
classic
hi guys thanks for watching this video
